content:
Hello, I recently opened my first mathlib PR and fixed all CI errors, but it still doesn't show up on the review queue.
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/28818
The PR seems to follow every requirement in Why is my PR not on the queue?, with 6 checkmarks and no blocks/conflicts/draft.
Why is my PR not on the queue? Did I miss something?
Thanks!
An explanation I have heard is that the board has some delay. Not sure if still applicable
Not sure but I noticed your PR was waiting for someone to approve some CI jobs on it (I just did), maybe that was confusing the queueboard.

As the perhaps main author of the queueboard, I can confirm both explanations somewhat:

  • to be on the queue, a PR's CI jobs must have passed --- if they haven't even been run yet, that's certainly not hte case yet
  • the queueboard does update with some delay. (Usually, that's 15 minutes; sometimes the data for particular PRs can lag behind. This is a known issue, but fixing this reliably is much harder than one may think.)
In any case, the PR is shown as passing CI now, and is also on the review queue.
Thanks for asking; don't hesitate to ask again if something is confusing or unclear.
(I'll try to clarify the on the queue page for such cases, for example.)
I wonder if there's a way to list the PRs that need a push on the "approve running CI" button
Or if we can make that unnecessary - most of the jobs seem not to need it

Michael Rothgang said:

In any case, the PR is shown as passing CI now, and is also on the review queue.

As far as I remember, https://leanprover-community.github.io/queueboard/on_the_queue.html showed a green check mark for CI before the CI job was approved and run. It seems like there is some mismatch between it and the actual queue logic.
I think it's fine to turn off the requirement for approval for first time authors now.
Unfortunately it seems we can't turn off that requirement completely, but I have now turned it off for people who are not "new to GitHub", whatever that means.
Why does it impact only that job?
